docblock.description: ArangoDB PHP client: value validator
A simple validator for values to be stored in the database
Validate the value of a variable
docblock.long-description: Allowed value types are string, integer, double and booleans. Arrays are also allowed if they contain only one of the former types.

tag.name: return
tag.description: - will throw if an invalid value type is passed

docblock.description: ArangoDB PHP client: exception base class
Exception base class used to throw Arango specific exceptions
ArangoDB PHP client: bind variables
A simple container for bind variables This container also handles validation of the bind values.
Current bind values
Get all registered bind variables

tag.name: return
tag.description: - array of all registered bind variables

docblock.description: Get the number of bind variables registered
Get the value of a bind variable with a specific name
Set the value of a single bind variable or set all bind variables at once
docblock.long-description:
This will also validate the bind values.

Allowed value types for bind parameters are string, int, double, bool and array. Arrays must not contain any other than these types.

tag.name: param
tag.description: name - name of bind variable OR an array with all bind variables

docblock.description: ArangoDB PHP client: scope
Executes a function on scope entry and executes another function (cleanup) when the scope is exited
Scope has not been entered
Scope has been entered but not left
Scope has been entered and left
Initialization function (called on scope entry)
Exit function (called when scope is left)
Value returned by call to init function
Current scope state
Initialise the scope

tag.name: param
tag.description: - function to be called when scope is entered

tag.name: param
tag.description: - function to be called when scope if left

docblock.description: Destroy the scope
docblock.long-description: This will call leave() to ensure the scope is definitely left

docblock.description: Leave the scope
docblock.long-description: This will execute the exit func with the value returned by the call to the init func. leave() will check whether the scope has already been left to avoid duplicate execution of the exit func.

docblock.description: Enter the scope
docblock.long-description: This will call the init func and store its result value

docblock.description: Clone function
docblock.long-description: Scopes should never be cloned so this is private

docblock.description: ArangoDB PHP client: connection options
Simple container class for connection options.
docblock.long-description: This class also provides the default values for the connection options and will perform a simple validation of them. It provides array access to its members.

docblock.description: Endpoint string index constant
Host name string index constant (deprecated, use endpoint instead)
Port number index constant (deprecated, use endpoint instead)
Timeout value index constant
Trace function index constant
"Create collections if they don't exist" index constant
Update revision constant
Update policy index constant
Wait for sync index constant
Authentication user name
Authentication password
Authentication type
Connection
Reconnect flag
The current options
The connection endpoint object
Set defaults, use options provided by client and validate them
Get all options
Set and validate a specific option, necessary for ArrayAccess
Check whether an option exists, necessary for ArrayAccess

tag.name: return
tag.description: - true if option exists, false otherwise

docblock.description: Remove an option and validate, necessary for ArrayAccess
Get a specific option, necessary for ArrayAccess

tag.name: return
tag.description: - value of option, will throw if option is not set

docblock.description: Get the endpoint object for the connection
Get the default values for the options
Return the supported authorization types
Return the supported connection types
Validate the options

tag.name: return
tag.description: - will throw if an invalid option value is found

docblock.description: ArangoDB PHP client: statement
Container for a read-only ("select") statement A statement is an AQL query that can be issued to the server.
docblock.long-description: Optional bind parameters can be used when issuing the statement to separate the statement from the values. Executing a statement will result in a cursor being created.

docblock.description: Query string index
Count option index
Batch size index
Bind variables index
The connection object
The bind variables and values used for the statement
The current batch size (number of result documents retrieved per roundtrip)
The count flag (should server return total number of results)
The query string
Sanitation flag (if set, the _id and _rev attributes will be removed from the results)
Initialise the statement
Execute the statement
docblock.long-description: This will post the query to the server and return the results as a Cursor. The cursor can then be used to iterate the results.

docblock.description: Invoke the statement
docblock.long-description: This will simply call execute(). Arguments are ignored.

tag.name: param
tag.description: - arguments for invocation, will be ignored

docblock.description: Return a string representation of the statement
Bind a parameter to the statement
docblock.long-description:
This method can either be called with a string $key and a separate value in $value, or with an array of all bind bind parameters in $key, with $value being NULL.

Allowed value types for bind parameters are string, int, double, bool and array. Arrays must not contain any other than these types.

tag.name: param
tag.description: - name of bind variable OR an array of all bind variables

docblock.description: Get all bind parameters as an array
Set the query string
Get the query string
Set the count option for the statement
Get the count option value of the statement
Set the batch size for the statement
docblock.long-description:
The batch size is the number of results to be transferred in one server roundtrip. If a query produces more results than the batch size, it creates a server-side cursor that provides the additional results.

The server-side cursor can be accessed by the client with subsequent HTTP requests.

docblock.description: Get the batch size for the statement
Build an array of data to be posted to the server when issuing the statement

tag.name: return
tag.description: - array of data to be sent to server

docblock.description: Return an array of cursor options
ArangoDB PHP client: document handler
A document handler that fetches documents from the server and persists them on the server.
docblock.long-description: It does so by issuing the appropriate HTTP requests to the server.

docblock.description: documents array index
collection parameter
example parameter
Get a single document from a collection
docblock.long-description: Alias method for getById()

tag.name: param
tag.description: - collection id as a string or number

tag.name: param
tag.description:
- optional, array of options

Options are :

  • 'includeInternals' - true to include the internal attributes. Defaults to false
  • 'ignoreHiddenAttributes' - true to show hidden attributes. Defaults to false

tag.name: return
tag.description: - the document fetched from the server

docblock.description: Get a single document from a collection
docblock.long-description: This will throw if the document cannot be fetched from the server

tag.name: param
tag.description: - collection id as a string or number

tag.name: param
tag.description:
- optional, array of options

Options are :

  • 'includeInternals' - true to include the internal attributes. Defaults to false
  • 'ignoreHiddenAttributes' - true to show hidden attributes. Defaults to false

tag.name: return
tag.description: - the document fetched from the server

docblock.long-description: This will throw if the list cannot be fetched from the server

tag.name: param
tag.description: - collection id as string or number

tag.name: return
tag.description: - ids of documents in the collection

tag.name: deprecated
tag.description: to be removed in version 2.0 - This function is being replaced by CollectionHandler::getAllIds()

docblock.long-description: This will throw if the list cannot be fetched from the server

tag.description: - collection id as string or number

tag.description: - the example document as a Document object or an array

tag.name: param
tag.description: - remove _id and _rev attributes from result documents

tag.name: deprecated
tag.description: to be removed in version 2.0 - This function is being replaced by CollectionHandler::byExample()

docblock.description: Add a document to a collection
docblock.long-description:
This will add the document to the collection and return the document's id

This will throw if the document cannot be created

tag.name: param
tag.description: - collection id as string or number

tag.name: param
tag.description: - create the collection if it does not yet exist

tag.name: deprecated
tag.description: to be removed in version 2.0 - This function is being replaced by save()

docblock.description: save a document to a collection
docblock.long-description:
This will add the document to the collection and return the document's id

This will throw if the document cannot be saved

tag.name: param
tag.description: - collection id as string or number

tag.name: param
tag.description: - create the collection if it does not yet exist

docblock.description: Update an existing document in a collection, identified by the document itself
docblock.long-description:
This will update the document on the server

This will throw if the document cannot be updated

If policy is set to error (locally or globally through the connectionoptions) and the passed document has a _rev value set, the database will check that the revision of the to-be-replaced document is the same as the one given.

tag.name: param
tag.description: - update policy to be used in case of conflict

tag.name: return
tag.description: - always true, will throw if there is an error

tag.name: deprecated
tag.description: Attention!! to be removed in version 1.1 - This function is being replaced by replace()

docblock.description: Replace an existing document in a collection, identified by the document itself
docblock.long-description:
This will update the document on the server

This will throw if the document cannot be updated

If policy is set to error (locally or globally through the connectionoptions) and the passed document has a _rev value set, the database will check that the revision of the to-be-replaced document is the same as the one given.

tag.name: param
tag.description: - update policy to be used in case of conflict

tag.name: return
tag.description: - always true, will throw if there is an error

docblock.description: Update an existing document in a collection, identified by collection id and document id
docblock.long-description:
This will update the document on the server

This will throw if the document cannot be updated

If policy is set to error (locally or globally through the connectionoptions) and the passed document has a _rev value set, the database will check that the revision of the to-be-replaced document is the same as the one given.

tag.name: param
tag.description: - collection id as string or number

tag.name: param
tag.description: - document id as string or number

tag.name: param
tag.description: - update policy to be used in case of conflict

tag.name: return
tag.description: - always true, will throw if there is an error

tag.name: deprecated
tag.description: Attention!! to be removed in version 1.1 - This function is being replaced by replaceById()

docblock.description: Replace an existing document in a collection, identified by collection id and document id
docblock.long-description:
This will update the document on the server

This will throw if the document cannot be Replaced

If policy is set to error (locally or globally through the connectionoptions) and the passed document has a _rev value set, the database will check that the revision of the to-be-replaced document is the same as the one given.

tag.name: param
tag.description: - collection id as string or number

tag.name: param
tag.description: - document id as string or number

tag.name: param
tag.description: - update policy to be used in case of conflict

tag.name: return
tag.description: - always true, will throw if there is an error

tag.description: - policy to be used in case of conflict

tag.description: - always true, will throw if there is an error

tag.description: - policy to be used in case of conflict

docblock.description: ArangoDB PHP client: connection
Provides access to the ArangoDB server As all access is done using HTTP, we do not need to establish a persistent connection and keep its state.
docblock.long-description: Instead, connections are established on the fly for each request and are destroyed afterwards.

docblock.description: Api Version
Connection options
Connection handle, used in case of keep-alive
Flag if keep-alive connections are used
Set up the connection object, validate the options provided
Close existing connection handle if a keep-alive connection was used
Get an option set for the connection
Issue an HTTP GET request
Issue an HTTP POST request with the data provided
Issue an HTTP PUT request with the data provided
Issue an HTTP PATCH request with the data provided
Issue an HTTP DELETE request with the data provided
Get a connection handle
docblock.long-description: If keep-alive connections are used, the handle will be stored and re-used

docblock.description: Parse the response return the body values as an assoc array

tag.name: param
tag.description: - the response as supplied by the server

docblock.description: Execute an HTTP request and return the results
docblock.long-description:
This function will throw if no connection to the server can be established or if there is a problem during data exchange with the server.

The function might temporarily alter the value of the php.ini value 'default_socket_timeout' but will restore it.

docblock.description: Get the client api version
ArangoDB PHP client: default values
Contains default values used by the client
Default port number (used if no port specified)
Default timeout value (used if no timeout value specified)
Default value for waitForSync (fsync all data to disk on document updates/insertions/deletions)
Default value for createCollection (create the collection on the fly when the first document is added to an unknown collection)
Default value for HTTP Connection header
Default update policy
ArangoDB PHP client: connect exception
This exception type will be thrown by the client when there is an error during connecting to the server
Return a string representation of the exception
ArangoDB PHP client: client exception
This exception type will be thrown by the client when there is an error on the client side, i.e.
docblock.long-description: something the server is not involved in.

docblock.description: Return a string representation of the exception
ArangoDB PHP client: server exception
This exception type will be thrown by the client when the server returns an error in response to a client request.
docblock.long-description: The exception code is the HTTP status code as returned by the server. In case the server provides additional details about the error, these details can be queried using the getDetails() function.

docblock.description: Error number index
Error message index
Optional details for the exception
Return a string representation of the exception
Set exception details
docblock.long-description: If the server provides additional details about the error that occurred, they will be put here.

docblock.description: Get exception details
docblock.long-description: If the server has provided additional details about the error that occurred, they can be queries using the method

docblock.description: Get server error code
docblock.long-description: If the server has provided additional details about the error that occurred, this will return the server error code

docblock.description: Get server error message
docblock.long-description: If the server has provided additional details about the error that occurred, this will return the server error string

docblock.description: Get document(s) by specifying an example
docblock.long-description: This will throw if the list cannot be fetched from the server

tag.name: param
tag.description: - collection id as string or number

tag.name: param
tag.description: - the example document as a Document object or an array

tag.name: param
tag.description:
- optional, prior to v1.0.0 this was a boolean value for sanitize, since v1.0.0 it's an array of options.

Options are :

  • 'sanitize' - true to remove _id and _rev attributes from result documents. Defaults to false.
  • 'hiddenAttributes' - set an array of hidden attributes for created documents.

    This is actually the same as setting hidden attributes using setHiddenAttributes() on a document. The difference is, that if you're returning a resultset of documents, the getall() is already called and the hidden attributes would not be applied to the attributes.

docblock.description: Get the list of all documents' ids from a collection
docblock.long-description: This will throw if the list cannot be fetched from the server

tag.name: param
tag.description: - collection id as string or number

tag.name: return
tag.description: - ids of documents in the collection

docblock.description: Return an array of cursor options
ArangoDB PHP client: endpoint
Endpoint specification
docblock.long-description:
An endpoint contains the server location the client connects to the following endpoint types are currently supported (more to be added later): - tcp://host:port for tcp connections - unix://socket for UNIX sockets (provided the server supports this) - ssl://host:port for SSL connections (provided the server supports this)

Note: SSL support is added in ArangoDB server 1.1

docblock.description: TCP endpoint type
SSL endpoint type
UNIX socket endpoint type
Regexp for TCP endpoints
Regexp for SSL endpoints
Regexp for UNIX socket endpoints
Current endpoint value
Create a new endpoint
Return a string representation of the endpoint
Return the type of an endpoint
Return the host name of an endpoint
check whether an endpoint specification is valid

tag.name: return
tag.description: - true if endpoint specification is valid, false otherwise

Value object representing a collection
Collection id index

The key (attribute name) must be a string.

This will validate the value of the attribute and might throw an exception if the value is invalid.

docblock.long-description: This will throw if the id of an existing collection gets updated to some other id

docblock.description: Get the collection id (if already known)
docblock.long-description:
Collection ids are generated on the server only.

Collection ids are numeric but might be bigger than PHP_INT_MAX. To reliably store a collection id elsewhere, a PHP string should be used

tag.name: return
tag.description: - collection id, might be NULL if collection does not yet have an id

docblock.long-description: This is useful before a collection is create() 'ed in order to set a different type than the normal one. For example this must be set to 3 in order to create an edge-collection.

- optional, array of options that will be passed to the getAll function

  • 'ignoreHiddenAttributes' - true to show hidden attributes. Defaults to false

Set a document attribute

docblock.long-description: This is a magic method that allows the object to be used without declaring all document attributes first. This function is mapped to set() internally.

- optional, array of options for the getAll function, or the boolean value for $includeInternals

Options are :

  • 'ignoreHiddenAttributes' - true to show hidden attributes. Defaults to false

Get the hidden attributes

docblock.long-description: Document ids are generated on the server only. Document ids consist of collection id and document id, in the format collectionid/documentid

docblock.description: Convenience function to get the document handle (if already known) - is an alias to getInternalId()
docblock.long-description: Document handles are generated on the server only. Document handles consist of collection id and document id, in the format collectionid/documentid

tag.name: return
tag.description: - internal document id, might be NULL if document does not yet have an id

docblock.description: Get the document id (if already known)
docblock.long-description: Document ids are generated on the server only. Document ids are numeric but might be bigger than PHP_INT_MAX. To reliably store a document id elsewhere, a PHP string should be used

tag.name: return
tag.description: - document id, might be NULL if document does not yet have an id

docblock.description: Get the collection id (if already known)
docblock.long-description: Collection ids are generated on the server only. Collection ids are numeric but might be bigger than PHP_INT_MAX. To reliably store a collection id elsewhere, a PHP string should be used

tag.name: return
tag.description: - collection id, might be NULL if document does not yet have an id

docblock.description: Set the document revision
docblock.long-description:
Revision ids are generated on the server only.

Document ids are numeric but might be bigger than PHP_INT_MAX. To reliably store a document id elsewhere, a PHP string should be used

docblock.description: Get the document revision (if already known)

tag.name: return
tag.description: - revision id, might be NULL if document does not yet have an id

ArangoDB PHP client: document handler
An edge-document handler that fetches edges from the server and persists them on the server.
docblock.long-description: It does so by issuing the appropriate HTTP requests to the server.

docblock.description: ArangoDB PHP client: autoloader
Handles automatic loading of missing class files The autoloader can be nested with other autoloaders.
docblock.long-description: It will only process classes from its own namespace and ignore all others.

docblock.description: Class file extension
Directory with library files
Initialise the autoloader
Handle loading of an unknown class
docblock.long-description:
This will only handle class from its own namespace and ignore all others.

This allows multiple autoloaders to be used in a nested fashion.

tag.name: param
tag.description: - name of class to be loaded

docblock.description: Check the runtime environment
docblock.long-description: This will check whether the runtime environment is compatible with the Arango PHP client.

ArangoDB PHP client: result set cursor
Provides access to the results of a read-only statement
docblock.long-description:
The cursor might not contain all results in the beginning.

If the result set is too big to be transferred in one go, the cursor might issue additional HTTP requests to fetch the remaining results from the server.

docblock.description: result entry for cursor id
result entry for "hasMore" flag
result entry for result documents
sanitize option entry
The connection object
Cursor options
The result set
"has more" indicator - if true, the server has more results
cursor id - might be NULL if cursor does not have an id
current position in result set iteration (zero-based)
total length of result set (in number of documents)
Initialise the cursor with the first results and some metadata

tag.name: param
tag.description: - initial result data as returned by the server

docblock.description: Explicitly delete the cursor
docblock.long-description: This might issue an HTTP DELETE request to inform the server about the deletion.

tag.name: return
tag.description: - true if the server acknowledged the deletion request, false otherwise

docblock.description: Get the total number of results in the cursor
docblock.long-description: This might issue additional HTTP requests to fetch any outstanding results from the server

docblock.description: Get all results as an array
docblock.long-description: This might issue additional HTTP requests to fetch any outstanding results from the server
